com.vector.cfg.automation.scripting.api.project

Interface IProject

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, IDisposable, IDynamicObjectAware

    @DynamicTarget(value={"com.vector.cfg.model.groovy.api.IModelReadApiEntryPoint","com.vector.cfg.gen.core.bswmdmodel.groovy.api.IBswmdModelApiEntryPoint","com.vector.cfg.model.groovy.api.ITransactionApiEntryPoint","com.vector.cfg.model.groovy.api.IVarianceApiEntryPoint","com.vector.cfg.consistency.groovy.api.IValidationApiEntryPoint","com.vector.cfg.gen.core.genusage.groovy.api.IGenerationApiEntryPoint","com.vector.cfg.automation.api.domain.IDomainApiEntryPoint"})
 @PublishedApi(value=ADDITIONS_ALLOWED)
 @PublishedApiDomain(value=AUTOMATION_IF)
public interface IProject
extends IDynamicObjectAware, java.lang.AutoCloseable, IDisposable
    Projects in the AutomationInterface are represented by IProject instances. These instances can be created by:
    • Creating a new project
    • Loading an existing project

    You can only access IProject instances by using a Closure block at IProjectHandlingApi or IProjectRef class. This shall prevent memory leaks, by not closing open projects.

    All methods will throw an IllegalStateException, if the IProject was already disposed (closed). You can not call any methods, when the project was closed.

    (c) Copyright Vctr Informatik GmbH. All Rights Reserved.

    See Also:
    IProjectRef

    • Method Detail

      • close

        @PublishedMethod
void close()
        Closes this IProject. After this call any other call to the IProject will throw an IllegalStateException. It is not required to close the project, because it is automatically closed, when the project scope is left.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

      • getDpaProjectFilePath

        @PublishedMethod
java.nio.file.Path getDpaProjectFilePath()
        Returns the Path to the Dpa file of this Project as absolute path.
        Returns:
        the project path to the Dpa file

<T> T getInstance(java.lang.Class<T> instanceClass)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        service instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if the argument is null
        com.google.inject.ConfigurationException - if this IServiceContext cannot find or create the provider.
        com.google.inject.ProvisionException - if there was a runtime failure while providing an instance.
